record.field: An omnivorous diet includes both plant (fruits, vegetables, legumes, grains, nuts, and seeds) and animal foods (meat, fish, poultry, eggs, dairy products and honey).
The carnivore diet is a restrictive diet that only includes meat, fish, and other animal foods like eggs and certain dairy products. It excludes all other plant foods.
A mostly vegetarian diet that incorporates occasional meat, fish or poultry.
The pescatarian diet eliminates meat and poultry but allows fish and shellfish.
The vegetarian diet involves abstaining from eating meat, fish and poultry, but allows eggs and dairy products.
The vegan diet eliminates meat, fish, poultry, eggs and dairy products, as well as other animal-derived products, such as honey.
